page.title: 03Changes in farming,Scotforth
page.content: When this farmer started farming 50 years ago he had 70 acres and now he has 119 acres. Originally he had no electricity but the cable was laid in 1930. Their water was all from natural springs but now they are on the main water supply.50 years ago cattle were milked by hand in sheds now machines in milking parlours are used. The increase in milk yield over the last 30 years is 200 gallons per cow pa. This farmer still bottles his own milk. This is unusual as most farmers have their milk collected each day by tanker & bottled in a central dairy in Lancaster.50 years ago they took hay from the fields but now use silage. Recreation 50 years ago was church meetings & occasional visits to the picture houses. He now has 5 tractors not 1, and lives in a modern bungalow not the old stone farmhouse.
